text.__SUMMARY__: Phyllanthus myrtifolius, known as mousetail plant or myrtle-leaf leaf-flower, is a shrub belonging to the genus Phyllanthus of the family Phyllanthaceae endemic to island of Sri Lanka.
text.Leaves: Numerous in 2-3's on suppressed branchlets, lanceolate-linear.
text.Trunk: Stems numerous, irregular; branchlets resemble pinnate leaves; B- vertically fissured; young parts finely pubescent.
text.Flowers: Inflorescence - several together in lax clusters.
text.Fruits: Purplish red to greenish, small, depressed, slightly 3-lobed, capsule.
text.Ecology: Along water courses in forest; gardens.
text.Culture: Known as ගඟ වැ‍රැල්ල (gaga werella) in Sinhala.
